subsc: Other social services,Central government administration,Tertiary education,Secondary education

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey satisfactory
            outcomes, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Lessons outline the
            importance for the project design to maintain a balance
            between detail, and flexibility, which in this case, was
            afforded to component development, and change during
            execution, namely in the teacher training component, in the
            significant increase in textbooks provided, and in the
            addition of new subject texts. Moreover, the broad-based
            ownership of the project within the Ministry of Education,
            is an important explanatory factor for the project success :
            the semi-autonomous Project Unit was able to successfully
            involve the relevant parties, in the design, and
            implementation processes, while maintaining an effective
            administrative control of the project. However, despite the
            overall simplicity of project design, the coordination of
            support for the new curriculum, and teaching methods fell
            short. The main weakness from the Bank's perspective
            was in the content of teacher training; instead, an earlier
            attempt to target specific, partial quality improvements,
            such as the use of textbooks, might have facilitated earlier
            quality gains on a limited scale. Other lessons address the
            demand for better education, and the importance of local
            stakeholder participation; the importance of having an
            evaluation plan in place at the project start-up; and, the
            need to involve the Borrower in donor coordination.
